snippet: A federal judge ordered the Marvell Technology Group to pay Carnegie Mellon University for selling billions of semiconductors that infringed the school’s two hard disk drive patents.
abstract: Judge Nora Barry Fischer of Federal District Court in Pittsburgh orders Marvell Technology Group to pay nearly $1.54 billion to Carnegie Mellon University for selling billions of semiconductors that infringed school’s two hard disk drive patents.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge ordered the Marvell Technology Group to pay Carnegie Mellon University for selling billions of semiconductors that infringed the school’s two hard disk drive patents.

headline.main: Marvell Ordered to Pay $1.54 Billion in Patent Suit
headline.print_headline: Marvell Ordered to Pay $1.54. Billion in Patent Suit
